title: Dark City
review: I'm a big fan of this, especially its visual style. I imagine this is the kind of film Terry Gilliam would make if he wasn't so obsessed with being subversive. It's similar to Brazil and 12 Monkeys so Gilliam would never have done it; he never sticks with something that worked. The sets are great and I can see that The Matrix used some identical shots on the same sets, like when the phone rings in an empty room, or the rooftop fight. It was a good idea to set this noir supernatural drama in a city that is perpetually at nighttime, as that is the noirest time of day.
